column4: amphi:do you know if that mail area is readable through like squirrelmail or any other web based email clients?
amphi:I would like to throw in a web based email client to get my mail remotely
I think i am biting off too much
Ane asy start would be to install uw-imapd. That will give you access to mail in /var/mail/ and stuff in ~/mbox or ~/Mail
squirrelmail always runs fine on `localhost' too ;-)
using synaptic I selected squirrelmail and none of the dependencies are related to mail at all, php stuff and the like only
squirrelmail doesn't *need* a local imap server (you can make it talk to any imap server, anywhere) so it woulnd't install one.
How hard is it to configure squirrelmail, have you done it before?
It's *really* easy. It comes with a little perl script that just displays menus (text-based)
Since I need to get the mail from gmail for all users, fetchmail passes it off to postfix, and then will postfix place it in whatever type of folder/dir i specify?
By default, postfix delivers it to an mbox format mail file in /var/mail
If you install uw-imap, it can read those mail stores and interface with squirrelmail.
Do you have time to help me out with squirrelmail?  I spoke with you the other day regarding this issue.

I am assuming that you are the cat responsible for .debs that bear your name.  I am noticing that you have a gktpod v.0.99.8-0, and that you have no gtkpod-aac v.0.99.8-0.  Does the repo version support aac and you forgot to label as, or does not a beast exist?
